body:
few doubts  :
1. So after moving it to  config of model we'll be passing features like this ->
```
dffml train \
-model tfdnnr\
-model-features\ 
            def:Feature1:float:1 \    
            def:Feature2:float:1 \
```
is this the intented result?
2. Since there is a `super().__init__(parent, features)` in almost all the `ModelContexts` ,they need to be changed rit?

@aghinsa Great!

1. Yes that is what it will look like on the command line.
2. Yes, That will need to be changed.
3. The way it works right now is that features is set from the CLI command (which subclasses from the FeaturesCMD CLI command class):
https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/50b37429822996d20604c524a3cfc3f802eb1065/dffml/util/cli/cmds.py#L83-L89
4. That `Arg(...)` will need to be moved into the `args()` classmethod of each model, for example:
https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/50b37429822996d20604c524a3cfc3f802eb1065/model/tensorflow/dffml_model_tensorflow/dnnc.py#L426-L436
5. A `features` property of type `dffml.feature.feature.Features` needs to be added to the `...ModelConfig` class of each model, for example:
https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/50b37429822996d20604c524a3cfc3f802eb1065/model/tensorflow/dffml_model_tensorflow/dnnc.py#L91-L98
6. Then it needs to be retrieved in the `config()` classmethod of each model, for example:
https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/50b37429822996d20604c524a3cfc3f802eb1065/model/tensorflow/dffml_model_tensorflow/dnnc.py#L494-L502
7. Everywhere `self.features` is used in a `ModelContext` use `self.parent.config.features` (This is not always true, some models change `self.features` to the subset of applicable features).
Ohkay.I'll start with scikit models and for tf models i'll wait till you have merged tfdnnr,sounds okay?

In addition to `model.ModelConfig`, you'll need to add `features` to

### model/scikit 1

https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/50b37429822996d20604c524a3cfc3f802eb1065/model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/scikit_models.py#L106

### model/scikit 2

https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/50b37429822996d20604c524a3cfc3f802eb1065/model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/scikit_models.py#L117-L138


### model/scikit 3

https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/50b37429822996d20604c524a3cfc3f802eb1065/model/scikit/dffml_model_scikit/scikit_models.py#L156-L160

### model/scratch 1

https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/50b37429822996d20604c524a3cfc3f802eb1065/model/scratch/dffml_model_scratch/slr.py#L23-L25

### model/scratch 2

https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/50b37429822996d20604c524a3cfc3f802eb1065/model/scratch/dffml_model_scratch/slr.py#L216-L242

### model/tensorflow 1

https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/50b37429822996d20604c524a3cfc3f802eb1065/model/tensorflow/dffml_model_tensorflow/dnnc.py#L90-L101

### model/tensorflow 2

https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/50b37429822996d20604c524a3cfc3f802eb1065/model/tensorflow/dffml_model_tensorflow/dnnc.py#L424-L502
Oh!My bad,i had missed the first one .

@pdxjohnny i made the changes for `scikit`,`tensorflow`,`scratch` and corresponding test_cases and all of them passed.But `test_cli` is failing and i'm not sure what all to change.
`python3.7 setup.py test -s tests/test_cli.py`.

from the looks of it, [TestEvaluateAll](https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/39916228016385e72a3539fa6ac2f39a790dcd1f/tests/test_cli.py#L350),[TestEvaluateRepo](https://github.com/intel/dffml/blob/39916228016385e72a3539fa6ac2f39a790dcd1f/tests/test_cli.py#L374) doesn't depend on any model ,did i get that wrong?if not,then how do we pass model.config?

issue.title: WIP:Moves features from init of ModelContext to ModelConfig

repository.name: dffml
repository.description: The easiest way to use Machine Learning. Mix and match underlying ML libraries and data set sources. Generate new datasets or modify existing ones with ease.
